wikipedia_page.main: Henry Hogg Allan (8 October 1872 – 1965) was a Scottish footballer who played for Heart of Midlothian, East Fife and the Scotland national team.Allan joined Hearts from local Fife football in April 1897 and helped the club to their third Scottish Cup success in 1901. He earned a solitary cap for Scotland  in March 1902, playing in a 4–1 win over Wales. He represented the Scottish League XI on two occasions. In 1903 he became one of the founding players of East Fife. He later emigrated to Canada.
